info.title: Voucherify API
info.description: Voucherify promotion engine REST API. Please see https://docs.voucherify.io/docs for more details.

tags.name: Vouchers
tags.description: Manage discount and gift card vouchers.

tags.name: Campaigns
tags.description: Group vouchers or promotion tiers of a specific type.

tags.name: Async Actions
tags.description: Track asynchronous operations scheduled in Projects.

audienceRulesOnly.name: audienceRulesOnly
audienceRulesOnly.description: This parameter set to true will ask only for verifying vouchers' validation rules only against conditions applied to audiences' attributes (belonging into segment, customer metadata, customer redemption count). The remaining checks against limits and rules will be omitted during validation.

order.name: order
order.description: Sorts the results using one of the filtering options, where the dash `-` preceding a sorting option means sorting in a descending order.

limit.name: limit
limit.description: Limits the number of objects to be returned. The limit can range between 1 and 100 items. If no limit is set, it returns 10 items.

page.name: page
page.description: Which page of results to return. The lowest value is `1`.

category.name: category
category.description: Limit search results to vouchers within the specified category.

customer.name: customer
customer.description: A tracking identifier of a customer who is the holder of the vouchers. It can be an `id` generated by Voucherify or the `source_id`. Remember to use the proper URL escape codes if the `source_id` contains special characters.

campaign.name: campaign
campaign.description: A unique campaign name, identifies the parent campaign.

created_at.name: created_at
created_at.description: A filter on the list based on the object `created_at` field. The value is a dictionary with the following options: `before`, `after`. A date value must be presented in ISO 8601 format (`2016-11-16T14:14:31Z` or `2016-11-16`). An example: `[created_at][before]=2017-09-08T13:52:18.227Z`

updated_at.name: updated_at
updated_at.description: A filter on the list based on the object `updated_at` field. The value is a dictionary with the following options: `before`, `after`. A date value must be presented in ISO 8601 format (`2016-11-16T14:14:31Z` or `2016-11-16`). An example: `[updated_at][before]=2017-09-08T13:52:18.227Z`

start_date.name: start_date
start_date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time which results must end on. Represented in ISO 8601 format.

end_date.name: end_date
end_date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time which results must end on. Represented in ISO 8601 format.

starting_after.name: starting_after
starting_after.description: Timestamp representing the date and time to use in starting_after cursor to get more data. Represented in ISO 8601 format.

campaign_type.name: campaign_type
campaign_type.description: This attribute allows filtering by campaign type.

origin.name: origin
origin.description: Indicates the origin (scheme, hostname, and port).

metadata.name: metadata
metadata.description: Metadata key value pairs.

customer_id.description: Filter publications by customer ids.

is_referral_code.description: Filter publications by is referall code.

parent_object_id.description: Filter publications by parent object id.

related_object_id.description: Filter publications by related object id.

source_id.description: Filter publications by source id.

id.description: Unique identifier of the bin entry.

resource_type.description: Resource type of the resource moved to the bin.

$not_in.description: Array of resource values that should be included in the results (multiple values).

$ends_with.description: Value ends with the specified string.

resource_id.description: Unique identifier of the resource moved to the bin.

metadata.description: Allows you to create a filter based on the conditions set for promotion metadata values. The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the promotion tier. A set of key/value pairs that are attached to a promotion tier object. Stores additional information about the promotion tier in a structured format.

promotion_id.description: Allows you to create a filter based on the unique promotion ID.

oneOf.title: Customer details
oneOf.description: Customer source ID and/or customer metadata.

source_id.description: Customer source ID.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to a customer. The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the customer. It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format. This metadata can be used for validating whether the customer qualifies for a discount or it can be used in building customer segments.

oneOf.title: Customer ID
oneOf.description: Unique customer ID assigned by Voucherify, i.e. `cust_eWgXlBBiY6THFRJwX45Iakv4`.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the order. A set of key/value pairs that are attached to an order object. Stores additional information about the order in a structured format.

before.description: Timestamp representing the date and time before the voucher was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

after.description: Timestamp representing the date and time after the voucher was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

before.description: Timestamp representing the date and time before the voucher was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

after.description: Timestamp representing the date and time after the voucher was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

VouchersValidateRequestBody.title: Validate Voucher Request Body
VouchersValidateRequestBody.description: Request schema model for validating a voucher using **POST** `v1/vouchers/{code}/validate`.

id.description: Unique ID assigned by Voucherify of an existing order that will be linked to the redemption of this request.

source_id.description: Unique source ID of an existing order that will be linked to the redemption of this request.

customer_id.description: Unique customer ID of the customer making the purchase.

amount.description: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00) representing the total amount of the order. This is the sum of the order items' amounts.

discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-level discounts applied to the order.

applied_discount_amount.description: This field shows the order-level discount applied.

items_discount_amount.description: Sum of all product-specific discounts applied to the order.

items_applied_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all product-specific discounts applied in a particular request.  
`sum(items, i => i.applied_discount_amount)`

total_discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-level AND all product-specific discounts applied to the order.

total_applied_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all order-level AND all product-specific discounts applied in a particular request.  
`total_applied_discount_amount` = `applied_discount_amount` + `items_applied_discount_amount`

total_amount.description: Order amount after undoing all the discounts through the rollback redemption.

items.description: Array of items applied to the order.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to an order. It can be useful for storing additional information about the order in a structured format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

source_id.description: Unique source ID of an existing order that will be linked to the redemption of this request.

amount.description: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00) representing the total amount of the order. This is the sum of the order items' amounts.

initial_amount.description: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00) representing the total amount of the order. This is the sum of the order items' amounts.

discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-level discounts applied to the order.

items.description: Array of items applied to the order.

items_discount_amount.description: Sum of all product-specific discounts applied to the order.

applied_discount_amount.description: This field shows the order-level discount applied.

items_applied_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all product-specific discounts applied in a particular request.  
`sum(items, i => i.applied_discount_amount)`

total_applied_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all order-level AND all product-specific discounts applied in a particular request.  
`total_applied_discount_amount` = `applied_discount_amount` + `items_applied_discount_amount`

items.description: Array of items applied to the order.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to an order. It can be useful for storing additional information about the order in a structured format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

customer_id.description: Unique customer ID of the customer making the purchase.

date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the redemption was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

rollback_id.description: Unique ID of the redemption rollback.

rollback_date.description: Timestamp representing the date and tiem when the redemption rollback was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

related_object_id.description: Unique ID of the parent redemption.

related_object_parent_id.description: Represent's the campaign ID of the voucher if the redemption was based on a voucher that was part of bulk codes generated within a campaign. In case of a promotion tier, this represents the campaign ID of the promotion tier's parent campaign.

stacked.description: Contains a list of unique IDs of child redemptions, which belong to the stacked incentives.

rollback_stacked.description: Lists the rollback redemption IDs of the particular child redemptions.

VouchersValidateDiscountRequestBody.title: Vouchers Validate Discount Request Body
VouchersValidateDiscountRequestBody.description: Request schema model for validating a voucher using **POST** `v1/vouchers/{code}/validate`.

customer.description: Customer's information.

order.description: Order information.

session.description: Schema model for session lock object. The session object is required to establish a session between multiple parallel validation and redemption requests. If you only send the type parameter in the request, then by default the session lock will be established for 7 days. Read more on establishing a validation session.

customer.description: Customer's information.

order.description: Order information.

id.description: Unique ID assigned by Voucherify of an existing order that will be linked to the redemption of this request.

source_id.description: Unique source ID of an existing order that will be linked to the redemption of this request.

amount.description: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00) representing the total amount of the order. This is the sum of the order items' amounts.

items.description: Array of items applied to the order.

customer.description: This is an object containing information about the customer.

referrer.description: This is an ojbect containing information about the referrer.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to an order. It can be useful for storing additional information about the order in a structured format.

gift.description: Contains information on the number of gift card credits that the customer wants to apply to the order.

credits.description: The number of credits that the user wants to use from the gift card to fulfil the order. The value of credits cannot be higher than the current balance on the gift card. If the user gives more points than he has on the gift card, the application will return an error code in response. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

session.description: Schema model for session lock object. The session object is required to establish a session between multiple parallel validation and redemption requests. If you only send the type parameter in the request, then by default the session lock will be established for 7 days. Read more on establishing a validation session.

customer.description: Customer's information.

order.description: Order information.

id.description: Unique ID assigned by Voucherify of an existing order that will be linked to the redemption of this request.

source_id.description: Unique source ID of an existing order that will be linked to the redemption of this request.

amount.description: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00) representing the total amount of the order. This is the sum of the order items' amounts.

items.description: Array of items applied to the order.

customer.description: This is an object containing information about the customer.

referrer.description: This is an ojbect containing information about the referrer.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to an order. It can be useful for storing additional information about the order in a structured format.

reward.description: Contains information about the reward that the customer wants to redeem and the number of points the customer is choosing to use for the reward.

id.description: Unique reward ID assigned by Voucherify. The reward must be assigned to the campaign in order for the user to be able to use the reward.

points.description: The number of loyalty points that the user wants to spend in order to fulfill the order. The number of points cannot be higher than the current balance on the loyalty card. If the user gives more points than he/she has on the loyalty card, the application will return an error code in response.

session.description: Schema model for session lock object. The session object is required to establish a session between multiple parallel validation and redemption requests. If you only send the type parameter in the request, then by default the session lock will be established for 7 days. Read more on establishing a validation session.

description.description: An arbitrary string that you can attach to a customer object.

phone.description: Customer's phone number. This parameter is mandatory when you try to send out codes to customers via an SMS channel.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to a customer. The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the customer. It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format. This metadata can be used for validating whether the customer qualifies for a discount or it can be used in building customer segments.

id.description: The ID of an existing customer.

source_id.description: A unique identifier of the customer who validates a voucher. It can be a customer ID or email from a CRM system, database, or a third-party service. If you also pass a customer ID (unique ID assigned by Voucherify), the source ID will be ignored.

id.description: A unique identifier of an existing customer.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

id.description: The ID of an existing customer that will be linked to redemption in this request.

source_id.description: A unique identifier of the customer who validates a voucher. It can be a customer ID or email from a CRM system, database, or a third-party service. If you also pass a customer ID (unique ID assigned by Voucherify), the source ID will be ignored.

system_metadata.description: Object used to store system metadata information.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the customer was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the customer was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

assets.description: Contains information about the customer's cockpit.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

CustomerReferrals.title: Customer Referrals
CustomerReferrals.description: Summary of customer's referrals, in this case, the customer being the referee, i.e. information about the source of referrals and number of times the customer was referred by other customers.

total.description: Total number of times this customer received a referral, i.e. was referred by another customer.

campaigns.description: Contains an array of campaigns that served as the source of a referral for the customer.

items.title: Customer Referrals Campaigns Item
items.description: Contains information about the source of the referral.

campaign_id.description: Unique campaign ID, assigned by Voucherify.

referrer_id.description: Unique referrer ID, assigned by Voucherify. This is the customer ID of a customer that is referring this customer.

related_object_id.description: Related object id

date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the customer was referred in ISO 8601 format.

points.description: Customer's loyalty points.

referred_customers.description: Total number of customers referred by the customer.

campaigns.description: Contains campaigns with details about point balances and how many customers were referred by the customer.

additionalProperties.description: Contains details about the point balances left on loyalty cards and the number of referred customers in each campaign.

points.description: Remaining point balance in campaign.

loyalty_tier.description: Customer's loyalty tier within the campaign.

referred_customers.description: Number of customers referred by the customer in campaign.

total_amount.description: The total amount spent by the customer. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

total_count.description: Total number of orders made by the customer.

average_amount.description: Average amount spent on orders. `total_amount` ÷ `total_count`. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

last_order_amount.description: Amount spent on last order. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

last_order_date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time of the customer's last order in ISO 8601 format.

total_redeemed.description: Total number of redemptions made by the customer.

total_failed.description: Total number of redemptions that failed.

total_succeeded.description: Total number of redemptions that succeeded.

total_rolled_back.description: Total number of redemptions that were rolled back for the customer.

total_rollback_failed.description: Total number of redemption rollbacks that failed.

total_rollback_succeeded.description: Total number of redemption rollbacks that succeeded.

gift.description: Summary of gift card credits.

redeemed_amount.description: Total amount of gift card credits redeemed by customer. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

amount_to_go.description: Remaining gift card balance across all gift cards. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

loyalty_card.description: Summary of loyalty points.

redeemed_points.description: Total number of loyalty points redeemed by the customer.

points_to_go.description: Sum of remaining available point balance across all loyalty cards.

id.description: Unique identifier of the custom event.
Unique identifier of an existing customer. It is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: A unique identifier of the customer. It can be a customer ID or email from a CRM system, database, or a third-party service.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that are attached to the customer. It stores all custom attributes assigned to the customer.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

id.description: Unique identifier of the order line item.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the `order_item`.

source_id.description: The merchant's product/SKU ID (if it is different from the Voucherify product/SKU ID). It is useful in the integration between multiple systems. It can be an ID from an eCommerce site, a database, or a third-party service.

related_object.description: Used along with the `source_id` property, can be set to either SKU or product.

product_id.description: Unique identifier of the product. It is assigned by Voucherify.

sku_id.description: Unique identifier of the SKU. It is assigned by Voucherify.

quantity.description: Quantity of the particular item in the cart.

applied_quantity.description: Quantity of items changed by the application of a new quantity items. It can be positive when an item is added or negative if an item is replaced.

applied_quantity_amount.description: Amount for the items changed by the application of a new quantity items. It can be positive when an item is added or negative if an item is replaced.

applied_discount_quantity.description: Number of the discounted items applied in the transaction.

amount.description: Total amount of the order item (price * quantity).

discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-item-level discounts applied to the order.

applied_discount_amount.description: Order-level discount amount applied in the transaction.

price.description: Unit price of an item. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

subtotal_amount.description:
Final order item amount after the applied item-level discount.  If there are no item-level discounts applied, this item is equal to the `amount`.   
`subtotal_amount`=`amount`-`discount_amount`

sku_id.description: Unique identifier of the SKU. It is assigned by Voucherify.

product_id.description: Unique identifier of the product. It is assigned by Voucherify.

related_object.description: Used along with the source_id property, can be set to either sku or product.

source_id.description: The merchant's product/SKU ID (if it is different from the Voucherify product/SKU ID). It is useful in the integration between multiple systems. It can be an ID from an eCommerce site, a database, or a third-party service.

quantity.description: The quantity of the particular item in the cart.

initial_quantity.description: A positive integer in the smallest unit quantity representing the total amount of the order; this is the sum of the order items' quantity.

amount.description: The total amount of the order item (price * quantity).

discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-item-level discounts applied to the order.

initial_amount.description: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00) representing the total amount of the order. This is the sum of the order items' amounts.

price.description: Unit price of an item. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

product.description: An object containing details of the related product.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the product and is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The merchant's product ID (if it is different than Voucherify's product ID). It is really useful in case of integration between multiple systems. It can be an ID from an eCommerce site, a database or a 3rd party service.

override.description: The override set to `true` is used to store the product information in the system. If the product does not exist, it will be created with a source_id; if it does exist, the provided values for the name, price, and metadata will replace those already stored in the system. Override works only for endpoints that create an order in the database.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to a product. It can be useful for storing additional information about the product in a structured format.

price.description: Product price. A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

sku.description: An object containing details of the related SKU.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the SKU and is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The merchant's SKU ID (if it is different than Voucherify's SKU ID). It is really useful in case of integration between multiple systems. It can be an ID from an eCommerce site, a database or a 3rd party service.

override.description: The override set to `true` is used to store the product information in the system. If the product does not exist, it will be created with a source_id; if it does exist, the provided values for the name, price, and metadata will replace those already stored in the system.

price.description: SKU price. A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to an order item. It can be useful for storing additional information about the order item in a structured format.

id.description: Unique identifier of the order line item.

sku_id.description: Unique identifier of the SKU. It is assigned by Voucherify.

product_id.description: Unique identifier of the product. It is assigned by Voucherify.

related_object.description: Used along with the source_id property, can be set to either sku or product.

source_id.description: The merchant's product/SKU ID (if it is different from the Voucherify product/SKU ID). It is useful in the integration between multiple systems. It can be an ID from an eCommerce site, a database, or a third-party service.

quantity.description: The quantity of the particular item in the cart.

initial_quantity.description: A positive integer in the smallest unit quantity representing the total amount of the order; this is the sum of the order items' quantity.

amount.description: The total amount of the order item (price * quantity).

discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-item-level discounts applied to the order.

applied_discount_amount.description: This field shows the order-level discount applied.

applied_discount_quantity.description: Number of the discounted items applied in the transaction.

applied_quantity.description: Quantity of items changed by the application of a new quantity items. It can be positive when an item is added or negative if an item is replaced.

applied_quantity_amount.description: Amount for the items changed by the application of a new quantity items. It can be positive when an item is added or negative if an item is replaced.

initial_amount.description: A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00) representing the total amount of the order. This is the sum of the order items' amounts.

price.description: Unit price of an item. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

subtotal_amount.description:
Final order item amount after the applied item-level discount.  If there are no item-level discounts applied, this item is equal to the `amount`.   
`subtotal_amount`=`amount`-`applied_discount_amount`

product.description: An object containing details of the related product.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the product and is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The merchant's product ID (if it is different than Voucherify's product ID). It is really useful in case of integration between multiple systems. It can be an ID from an eCommerce site, a database or a 3rd party service.

override.description: The override set to `true` is used to store the product information in the system. If the product does not exist, it will be created with a source_id; if it does exist, the provided values for the name, price, and metadata will replace those already stored in the system.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to a product. It can be useful for storing additional information about the product in a structured format.

price.description: Product price. A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

sku.description: An object containing details of the related SKU.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the SKU and is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The merchant's SKU ID (if it is different than Voucherify's SKU ID). It is really useful in case of integration between multiple systems. It can be an ID from an eCommerce site, a database or a 3rd party service.

override.description: The override set to `true` is used to store the product information in the system. If the product does not exist, it will be created with a source_id; if it does exist, the provided values for the name, price, and metadata will replace those already stored in the system.

price.description: SKU price. A positive integer in the smallest currency unit (e.g. 100 cents for $1.00).

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to an SKU. It can be useful for storing additional information about the SKU in a structured format.

key.description: The session unique ID assigned by Voucherify or your own unique session ID. Sending an existing ID will result in overwriting an existing session. If no session key is provided, then a new ID will be generated.

type.description: This parameter is required to establish a new session.

ttl.description: Value for the period of time that the session is active. Units for this parameter are defined by the session.ttl_unit parameter.

ttl_unit.description: Defines the type of unit in which the session time is counted.

valid.description: Indicates whether the voucher is valid within the context of the parameters provided in the request body.

applicable_to.description: Contains list of items that qualify in the scope of the discount. These are definitions of included products, SKUs, and product collections. These can be discounted.

inapplicable_to.description: Contains list of items that do not qualify in the scope of the discount. These are definitions of excluded products, SKUs, and product collections. These CANNOT be discounted.

campaign_id.description: Voucher's parent campaign's unique ID.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

gift.description: Gift object response

loyalty.description: Contains the cost of reward in points.

points_cost.description: Number of points that wlil be deducted from loyaty card for the associated reward.

reward.description: Contains information about the reward that is being validated.

id.description: Unique reward ID assigned by Voucherify.

assignment_id.description: Unique reward assignment ID assigned by Voucherify.

points.description: Number of points applied to the reward.

session.description: Schema model for session lock object. The session object contains information about the session key that was used to establish a session between multiple parallel validation and redemption requests.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the voucher starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Voucher is inactive before this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the voucher expires in ISO 8601 format. Voucher is inactive after this date.

valid.description: Indicates whether the voucher is valid within the context of the parameters provided in the request body.

error.description: Detailed failure cause for the invalid voucher if the reason has a translation defined in the Dashboard → Project Settings → Error Messages.

message.description: Customized error message.

customer_id.description: Unique customer ID of the customer making the purchase.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

id.description: Unique product ID, assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: Product's source ID.

id.description: Unique SKU ID, assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: Product variant's source ID.

type.description: Discount type.

unit_off.description: Number of units to be granted a full value discount.

effect.description: Defines how the unit is added to the customer's order.

unit_type.description: The product deemed as free, chosen from product inventory (e.g. time, items).

product.description: Contains information about the product.

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the discount was calculated using a formula.

type.description: Discount type.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

unit_off.description: Number of units to be granted a full value discount.

effect.description: Defines how the unit is added to the customer's order.

unit_type.description: The product deemed as free, chosen from product inventory (e.g. time, items).

product.description: Contains information about the product.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

amount_off.description: Amount taken off the subtotal of a price. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the discount was calculated using a formula.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

percent_off.description: The percent discount that the customer will receive.

amount_limit.description: Upper limit allowed to be applied as a discount. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $6 maximum discount is written as 600.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the discount was calculated using a formula.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

fixed_amount.description: Sets a fixed value for an order total or the item price. The value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000. If the fixed amount is calculated by the formula, i.e. the `fixed_amount_formula` parameter is present in the fixed amount definition, this value becomes the **fallback value**. As a result, if the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the fixed value.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the discount was calculated using a formula.

VoucherWithCategories.title: Voucher With Categories
VoucherWithCategories.description: This is an object representing a voucher with categories.

Voucher.title: Voucher
Voucher.readmeTitle: Voucher with categories and validation rules assignments
Voucher.description: This is an object representing a voucher with categories and validation rules assignments.

VoucherBase.title: Voucher Base
VoucherBase.description: This is an object representing a voucher.

id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher.

code.description: A code that identifies a voucher. Pattern can use all letters of the English alphabet, Arabic numerals, and special characters.

campaign.description: A unique campaign name, identifies the voucher's parent campaign.

campaign_id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the voucher's parent campaign.

category.description: Tag defining the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers using the List Vouchers endpoint.

category_id.description: Unique category ID assigned by Voucherify.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

gift.description: Object representing gift parameters. Child attributes are present only if `type` is `GIFT_VOUCHER`. Defaults to `null`.

amount.description: Total gift card income over the lifetime of the card. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

balance.description: Available funds. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

effect.description: Defines how the credits are applied to the customer's order.

loyalty_card.description: Object representing loyalty card parameters. Child attributes are present only if `type` is `LOYALTY_CARD`. Defaults to `null`.

points.description: Total points incurred over the lifespan of the loyalty card.

balance.description: Points available for reward redemption.

next_expiration_date.description: The next closest date when the next set of points are due to expire.

next_expiration_points.description: The amount of points that are set to expire next.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the code starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the code expires in ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

is_referral_code.description: Flag indicating whether this voucher is a referral code; `true` for campaign type `REFERRAL_PROGRAM`.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

holder_id.description: Unique customer identifier of the redeemable holder. It equals to the customer ID assigned by Voucherify.

referrer_id.description: Unique identifier of the referring person.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. Default is `voucher`.

publish.description: Stores a summary of publication events: an event counter and endpoint to return details of each event. Publication is an assignment of a code to a customer, e.g. through a distribution.

object.description: The type of the object represented is by default `list`. To get this list, you need to make a call to the endpoint returned in the `url` attribute.

url.description: The endpoint where this list of publications can be accessed using a GET method. `/v1/vouchers/{voucher_code}/publications`

redemption.description: Stores a summary of redemptions that have been applied to the voucher.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

redeemed_quantity.description: How many times a voucher has already been redeemed.

object.description: The type of the object represented is by default `list`. To get this list, you need to make a call to the endpoint returned in the url attribute.

url.description: The endpoint where this list of redemptions can be accessed using a GET method. `/v1/vouchers/{voucher_code}/redemptions`

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the code expires in ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

is_referral_code.description: This is always false for loyalty members.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

holder_id.description: Unique identifier of the customer who owns the voucher.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. Default is `voucher`.

publish.description:
This object stores a summary of publish events: an events counter and an endpoint which can be called to return details of each event.  A publication is required for loyalty cards and referral codes. This object gets updated whenever a voucher has been published. Publication means assigning a code to a particular customer. Typically, a publication is made by distributing your codes to your customers, e.g. through Export to MailChimp or <!-- [publish voucher](OpenAPI.json/paths/~1publications/post) -->[publish voucher](ref:create-publication) API method. 

<!-- title: My Table Title -->

| -------- | :------: |
| `type`:`LOYALTY_CARD` |  `type`:`DISCOUNT_VOUCHER`   | 
| `is_referral_code`:`true`      |    `type`:`GIFT_VOUCHER`   |

url.description: The endpoint where this list of publications can be accessed using a GET method. `/v1/vouchers/{voucher_code}/publications`

VoucherCreateLoyaltyCardWithSpecificCode.title: Voucher Create Loyalty Card With Specific Code Or Code Config
Voucher Create Loyalty Card With Specific Code
VoucherCreateLoyaltyCardWithSpecificCode.readmeTitle: Create loyalty card with specific code

code.description: Code that identifies a voucher. The pattern can use all the letters of the English alphabet, Arabic numerals, and special characters. Pass this attribute in the request body to create a distinct code. Otherwise, either use the `code_config` object to set the rules that the Voucherify API will use to create a random code, or don't pass any code and Voucherify will generate a random code.

code.description: Code that identifies a voucher. The pattern can use all the letters of the English alphabet, Arabic numerals, and special characters. Pass this attribute in the request body to create a distinct code. Otherwise, either use the `code_config` object to set the rules that the Voucherify API will use to create a random code, or don't pass any code and Voucherify will generate a random code.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

campaign.description: Identifies the voucher's parent campaign using a unique campaign name.

campaign_id.description: Identifies the voucher's parent campaign using a unique campaign ID assigned by the Voucherify API.

category.description: The name of the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers with the [List Vouchers](ref:list-vouchers) endpoint.

category_id.description: Unique identifier assigned by Voucherify to the name of the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers with the [List Vouchers](ref:list-vouchers) endpoint.

start_date.description: Start date defines when the code starts to be active. Activation timestamp is presented in the ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration date defines when the code expires. Expiration timestamp is presented in the ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

validation_rules.description: Array containing the ID of the validation rule associated with the voucher.

redemption.description: Stores the quantity of redemptions that can be applied to the voucher.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

1_req_vouchers_code_POST.title: Create Voucher Request Body
1_req_vouchers_code_POST.description: Request body schema for creating a voucher.

campaign.description: Identifies the voucher's parent campaign using a unique campaign name. **Required** for `LOYALTY_CARD` type.

campaign_id.description: Identifies the voucher's parent campaign using a unique campaign ID assigned by the Voucherify API.

category.description: The name of the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers with the [List Vouchers](ref:list-vouchers) endpoint.

category_id.description: Unique identifier assigned by Voucherify to the name of the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers with the [List Vouchers](ref:list-vouchers) endpoint.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

gift.description: Defines gift card; **required** when type parameter is `GIFT_VOUCHER`.

amount.description: Define how many credits the gift card should have initially. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

effect.description: Defines how the credits are applied to the customer's order

loyalty_card.description: Defines loyalty card; **required** when type parameter is `LOYALTY_CARD`.

points.description: Define how many points the loyalty card should have initially.

start_date.description: Start date defines when the code starts to be active. Activation timestamp is presented in the ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration date defines when the code expires. Expiration timestamp is presented in the ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

validation_rules.description: Array containing the ID of the validation rule associated with the voucher.

redemption.description: Stores the quantity of redemptions that can be applied to the voucher.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of voucher objects.

vouchers.description: A dictionary that contains an array of  vouchers. Each entry in the array is a separate voucher object.

total.description: Returns how many vouchers in the project meet the limits defined by the query parameter definitions.

category.description: The name of the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers with the [List Vouchers](ref:list-vouchers) endpoint.

category_id.description: Unique identifier assigned by Voucherify to the name of the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers with the [List Vouchers](ref:list-vouchers) endpoint.

start_date.description: Start date defines when the code starts to be active. Activation timestamp is presented in the ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration date defines when the code expires. Expiration timestamp is presented in the ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

VouchersMetadataUpdateInBulkRequestBody.title: Update Vouchers' Metadata in Bulk Request Body

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

type.description: Applies an amount discount.

amount_off.description: Amount taken off the subtotal of a price. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000. In case of the amount being calculated by the formula, i.e. the `amount_off_formula` parameter is present in the amount definition, this value becomes the **fallback value**. Such that in a case where the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the amount off.

amount_off_formula.description: Formula used to calculate the discount.

aggregated_amount_limit.description:
Maximum discount amount per order. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $6 maximum discount on the entire order is written as 600. This value is definable for the following discount effects:
- `APPLY_TO_ITEMS` (each item subtotal is discounted equally)
- `APPLY_TO_ITEMS_BY_QUANTITY` (each unit of matched products has the same discount value)

effect.description:
Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order. The discount effects are defined as follows:
- `APPLY_TO_ORDER` (discount applies to the total order amount)
- `APPLY_TO_ITEMS` (each item subtotal is discounted equally)
- `APPLY_TO_ITEMS_PROPORTIONALLY` (split discount proportionally to amount)
- `APPLY_TO_ITEMS_PROPORTIONALLY_BY_QUANTITY` (split discount proportionally to quantity)
- `APPLY_TO_ITEMS_BY_QUANTITY` (each unit of matched products has the same discount value)

type.description: Applies a percentage discount.

amount_limit.description: Upper limit allowed to be applied as a discount per order line item. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $6 maximum discount is written as 600.

aggregated_amount_limit.description: Maximum discount amount per order. This value is definable for the `APPLY_TO_ITEMS` discount effect. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $6 maximum discount on the entire order is written as 600.

percent_off.description: Percent taken off the subtotal amount. In case of the percent being calculated by the formula, i.e. the `percent_off_formula` parameter is present in the percent definition, this value becomes the **fallback value**. Such that in a case where the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the percent off.

percent_off_formula.description: Formula used to calculate the discount.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

type.description: Sets a fixed total on cart or item(s) and then calculates the discount to apply.

fixed_amount.description: Sets a fixed value for an order total or the item price. The value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000. If the fixed amount is calculated by the formula, i.e. the `fixed_amount_formula` parameter is present in the fixed amount definition, this value becomes the **fallback value**. As a result, if the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the fixed value.

fixed_amount_formula.description: Formula used to calculate the discounted price of an item or a new order total.

effect.description:
| **Effect** | **Definition** |
|:---|:---|
| **APPLY_TO_ORDER** | Sets the order total amount to the value of the fixed amount. The discount value is calculated dynamically during the redemption as it's a difference between the total amount of the customer's order and the fixed amount. For example, if the fixed amount is set to equal $10 and the order amount equals $25, then the calculated discount will be $15. |
| **APPLY_TO_ITEMS** | Sets a new price on items. The total discount amount is dynamically calculated during the redemption and it's a difference between the initial item price and the fixed amount. During the redemption, prices for items will change only if the new price is lower than the original price. If the new product price you set is different from the product price in a collection, then the new product price will be passed during the redemption. If a prodct is in more than one collection, the price is always changed to the lowest price. The new price for products with several SKUs will force the price change for SKUs if their original price is higher than the new price. |

type.description: Applies a full value discount to item(s).

unit_off.description: Number of units to be granted a full value discount. In case of the unit being calculated by the formula, i.e. the `unit_off_formula` parameter is present in the unit definition, this value becomes the **fallback value**. Such that in a case where the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the unit value.

unit_off_formula.description: Formula used to calculate the number of units.

unit_type.description: The product deemed as free, chosen from the product  inventory (e.g. time, items).

effect.description: Defines how the unit is added to the customer's order.

type.description: Applies a full value discount to item(s).

effect.description: Defines the effect for adding multiple item types.

units.description: Array of objects defining items to be offered for free. Each item type can have a different discount effect assigned.

items.description: Object defining a unit discount.

unit_off_formula.description: Formula used to calculate the number of units.

unit_type.description: The product deemed as free, chosen from the product  inventory (e.g. time, items).

units.description: Array of objects defining items to be offered for free. Each item type can have a different discount effect assigned.

items.description: Object defining a unit discount.

unit_off.description: Number of units to be granted a full value discount. In case of the unit being calculated by the formula, i.e. the `unit_off_formula` parameter is present in the unit definition, this value becomes the **fallback value**. Such that in a case where the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the unit value.

unit_off_formula.description: Formula used to calculate the discount.

unit_type.description: The product deemed as free, chosen from the product  inventory (e.g. time, items).

effect.description: Defines how the unit is added to the customer's order.

type.description: Applies a full value discount to item(s).

unit_off.description: Subtracts 1 shipping item from the subtotal.

unit_type.description: The shipping product deemed as free.

effect.description: Defines how the unit is added to the customer's order.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of transaction objects.

data.description: A dictionary that contains an array of transactions. Each entry in the array is a separate transaction object.

has_more.description: As query results are always limited (by the limit parameter), the `has_more` flag indicates if there are more records for given filter parameters. This lets you know if you can run another request (with a different paging or a different start date filter) to get more records returned in the results.

more_starting_after.description: Returns an ID that can be used to return another page of results. Use the transaction ID in the `starting_after_id` query parameter to display another page of the results starting after the transaction with that ID.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of transaction objects.

data.description: A dictionary that contains an array of rewards. Each entry in the array is a separate transaction object.

total.description: Returns how many rewards in the project meet the limits defined by the query parameter definitions.

VoucherTransactionsExportParameters.description: List of available fields and filters that can be exported with a gift card or loyalty card transactions export along with the sorting order of the returned data.
VoucherTransactionsExportParameters.title: Export Transactions

order.description: How the export is filtered, where the dash `-` preceding a sorting option means sorting in a descending order.

fields.description:
Array of strings containing the data in the export. These fields define the headers in the CSV file. The array can be a combination of any of the following available fields: | **Field** | **Definition** | **Example Export** | |:---|:---|:---| | id | Unique transaction ID. | vtx_0cb7811f1c07765800 | | type | Transaction type. | - `CREDITS_REMOVAL`
- `CREDITS_ADDITION`
- `CREDITS_REFUND`
- `CREDITS_REDEMPTION`
- `POINTS_ACCRUAL`
- `POINTS_REDEMPTION`
- `POINTS_REFUND`
- `POINTS_ADDITION`
- `POINTS_REMOVAL`
- `POINTS_EXPIRATION`
- `POINTS_TRANSFER_IN`
- `POINTS_TRANSFER_OUT` | | source_id | Unique transaction source ID. | 8638 | | reason | Contains the reason for the transaction if one was included originally. | | | balance | The gift card or loyalty card balance after the transaction. | | | amount | The amount of gift card or loyalty card credits being allocated during the transaction. This value can either be negative or positive depending on the nature of the transaction. | | | created_at | Timestamp in ISO 8601 format representing the date and time when the transaction was created. | 2022-03-09T09:16:32.521Z | | voucher_id | Unique Voucher ID. | v_dky7ksKfPX50Wb2Bxvcoeb1xT20b6tcp | | campaign_id | Parent campaign ID. | camp_FNYR4jhqZBM9xTptxDGgeNBV | | source| Channel through which the transaction was initiated. | API | | details | More detailed information stored in the form of a JSON. | Provides more details related to the transaction in the form of an object. | | related_transaction_id | Unique transaction ID related to a receiver/donor card in the case of a points transfer from/to another card. | vtx_0c9afe802593b34b80 |

VoucherTransactionsExport.title: Voucher Transactions Export
VoucherTransactionsExport.description:
This is an object representing an export. 

 Using this endpoint, you can export voucher transactions as a CSV file. This functionality works asynchronously and comes down to the following steps: create an export object and return its id so you can track its status, trigger a CSV file generation, change the status to SCHEDULED when the generation is over, store the file in S3 and change the status to DONE. Now you can download it.

With parameters you can select which fields will be exported. An export request will almost always result in a single file being generated by the system. However, when your volume of data is large, the system may split the results into multiple chunks.

id.description: Unique export ID.

object.description: The type of object being represented. This object stores information about the `export`.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the export was scheduled in ISO 8601 format.

status.description: Status of the export. Informs you whether the export has already been completed, i.e. indicates whether the file containing the exported data has been generated.

channel.description: The channel through which the export was triggered.

result.description: Contains the URL of the CSV file.

url.description: URL of the CSV file location. It contains the `token` used for authorization in the <!-- [Download export](OpenAPI.json/paths/~1exports~1{export_Id}/get) -->[Download export](ref:download-export) method.

user_id.description: Identifies the specific user who initiated the export through the Voucherify Dashboard; returned when the `channel` value is `WEBSITE`.

VoucherImportBase.title: Voucher Import Base
VoucherImportBase.description: Object model for gift voucher object being imported.

redemption.description: Stores the quantity of redemptions that can be applied to the voucher.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

category.description: Tag defining the category that this voucher belongs to. Useful when listing vouchers using the [List Vouchers](ref:list-vouchers) endpoint.

start_date.description:
Activation timestamp presented in the ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date. Start date defines when the code starts to be active.
Allowed date formats are:
- YYYY-MM-DD
- YYYY-MM-DDTHH
- YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm
- YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss
- YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ
- YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.SSSZ

expiration_date.description:
Expiration date defines when the code expires. Expiration timestamp is presented in the ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.
Allowed date formats are:
- YYYY-MM-DD
- YYYY-MM-DDTHH
- YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm
- YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss
- YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ
- YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.SSSZ

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.
Defines the type of the voucher.
Defines the type of the voucher.

Gift.description: Contains current gift card balance information.

amount.description: Total gift card income over the lifetime of the card. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

RedeemableGift.title: Redeemable Gift
RedeemableGift.description: Contains current gift card balance information.

balance.description: Available funds. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

credits.description: The number of credits that the user wants to use from the gift card to fulfil the order. The value of credits cannot be higher than the current balance on the gift card. If the user gives more points than he has on the gift card, the application will return an error code in response. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

VouchersUpdateInBulkRequestBody.title: Vouchers Update In Bulk Request Body

VouchersUpdateInBulkItemRequestBody.title: Vouchers Update In Bulk Request Body Item

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

order.description: Tracks purchase transactions. You can send the order in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific order validation rules to be satisfied. The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure/Order volume_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Order_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

id.description: The ID of an existing order in Voucherify's system that will be linked to the redemption of this request. This ID was assigned by the Voucherify API. You can send the order id in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific order validation rules to be satisfied.

source_id.description: The merchant's order ID if it is different from the Voucherify order ID. It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be an order ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service.

amount.description:
Pre-discount order amount represents the total amount of order items' amounts (sum of each item's `amount` property). You can send the total order amount or the amount of each item individually in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific total order amount validation rules to be satisfied. The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order volume_ → _Total amount_ 

Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

items.description: List of Order Items constituting the order. Order items can be defined either by `product_id` or `sku_id`. For every item, you must define the quantity.

referrer.description: The person who referred the customer to make the order.

metadata.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **order** metadata validation rules to be satisfied. The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Order metadata satisfy_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Attributes match_ → _ORDER METADATA_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **redemption** metadata validation rules to be satisfied. The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Advanced_ → _Redemption metadata satisfy_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Attributes match_ → _REDEMPTION METADATA_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

1_req_obj_vouchers_qualification_custome.title: Customer Object
1_req_obj_vouchers_qualification_custome.description: This object stores customer details. You can send this object in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific customer validation rules to be satisfied. The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Audience_ → _Customer segment_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Customer Activity_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

id.description: The ID of an existing customer that will be linked to the redemption in this request. This ID was assigned by the Voucherify API.

source_id.description: A unique customer identifier. This is a tracking identifier of a user that is validating a voucher. The `source_id` is built based on your internal id (e.g., email, database ID). If you also pass a customer ID, the source ID will be ignored. Otherwise, if you do not pass a customer ID, the source ID you provide must either be a token, like the one returned in the original voucher validation method done by a specific customer, or a string identifying the customer (e.g., email, database ID, CRM ID).

name.description: First and Last Name. You can send the name in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific name validation rules to be satisfied.

email.description: You can send the email in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific email validation rules to be satisfied.

phone.description: You can send the phone in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific phone validation rules to be satisfied.

address.description: A set of key/value pairs which describes the address. You can send the address in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific address validation rules to be satisfied.

city.description: You can send the city in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific city validation rules to be satisfied.

country.description: You can send the country in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific country validation rules to be satisfied.

postal_code.description: You can send the postal code in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific postal code validation rules to be satisfied.

state.description: You can send the state in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific state validation rules to be satisfied.

metadata.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **customer** metadata validation rules to be satisfied. The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Audience_ → _Customer metadata satisfy_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

birthdate.description: You can send the birthdate in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific birthdate validation rules to be satisfied.

1_req_obj_vouchers_qualification_product.title: Product Item
1_req_obj_vouchers_qualification_product.description: Schema model for a product item. You can send this object in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific product validation rules to be satisfied. The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure/Order volume_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Order_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

source_id.description:
A unique product identifier from your inventory system. __Requires__ the `related_object` property to be defined. 

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the Create Validation Rules endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order Structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item/None of the order items_ → _Select a product collection or create a new product collection based on Source Id filters_ . [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/529-validation-rules-campaign-limits).

product_id.description: A unique identifier that represents the product and is assigned by Voucherify.

amount.description:
Represents a total pre-discount amount of order item (`price` * `quantity`). You can send the total item amount to check against vouchers requiring specific order amount validation rules to be satisfied.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order volume_ → _Total amount_. The qualification adds the individual amounts of the items and checks whether the sum meets the limits set by the _Total amount_. Additionally, another rule checked is one that is defined in _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item_ → _Subtotal of matched items_.  

Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

quantity.description:
Quantity of the item in the cart. 

The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order Volume_ → _Items quantity_. The qualification adds the individual quantities of the items and checks whether the sum meets the limits set by _Items quantity_ validation rule. Another validation rule against which the qualification does the checks is defined in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order Structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item_ → _Quantity of matched items_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/529-validation-rules-campaign-limits).

price.description:
Unit price of an item. [This is not true in the case of using sourceid what was the case that this happened.]This `price` property takes precedence. If you provide a value at this level, then a price property defined once again in the `related_object` will be ignored. If this property will not be defined here, then the `price` property in the `related_object` will be used in the qualification.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the Create Validation Rules endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order Structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item_ → _Unit Price of any matching order line_ and also _Order Volume_ → _Price of each item/Price of any item_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/529-validation-rules-campaign-limits).

 Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

metadata.description:
A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **order line item** metadata validation rules to be satisfied.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item_ → _Metadata of matched items_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

related_object.description: A reference to the object containing details of the related product. __Required__ when sending `source_id` in payload.

product.description: An object containing details of the related product. __Required__ when sending `source_id` in payload. These details will be used for qualification on top of details already stored in the system.

source_id.description: A unique product identifier from your inventory system.

name.description:
Product name.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item/None of the order items_ → _Select a product collection or create a new product collection based on name filters_.

price.description: Unit price of an item. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

metadata.description:
A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **product** metadata validation rules to be satisfied.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item/None of the order items_ → _Select a product collection or create a new product collection based on metadata filters_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).
