name.description:
Product name.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item/None of the order items_ → _Select a product collection or create a new product collection based on name filters_.

price.description: Unit price of an item. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

metadata.description:
A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **product** metadata validation rules to be satisfied.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item/None of the order items_ → _Select a product collection or create a new product collection based on metadata filters_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

1_req_obj_vouchers_qualification_product.title: Product Item using source_id
1_req_obj_vouchers_qualification_product.description: Schema model for a product item. You can send this object in the request body to check against vouchers requiring specific product validation rules to be satisfied. The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure/Order volume_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Order_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

source_id.description:
A unique product identifier from your inventory system. __Requires__ the `related_object` property to be defined. 

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the Create Validation Rules endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order Structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item/None of the order items_ → _Select a product collection or create a new product collection based on Source Id filters_ . [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/529-validation-rules-campaign-limits).

amount.description:
Represents a total pre-discount amount of order item (`price` * `quantity`). You can send the total item amount to check against vouchers requiring specific order amount validation rules to be satisfied.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order volume_ → _Total amount_. The qualification adds the individual amounts of the items and checks whether the sum meets the limits set by the _Total amount_. Additionally, another rule checked is one that is defined in _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item_ → _Subtotal of matched items_.  

Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

quantity.description:
Quantity of the item in the cart. 

The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order Volume_ → _Items quantity_. The qualification adds the individual quantities of the items and checks whether the sum meets the limits set by _Items quantity_ validation rule. Another validation rule against which the qualification does the checks is defined in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order Structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item_ → _Quantity of matched items_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/529-validation-rules-campaign-limits).

price.description:
Unit price of an item. [This is not true in the case of using sourceid what was the case that this happened.]This `price` property takes precedence. If you provide a value at this level, then a price property defined once again in the `related_object` will be ignored. If this property will not be defined here, then the `price` property in the `related_object` will be used in the qualification.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the Create Validation Rules endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order Structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item_ → _Unit Price of any matching order line_ and also _Order Volume_ → _Price of each item/Price of any item_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/529-validation-rules-campaign-limits).

 Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

metadata.description:
A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **order line item** metadata validation rules to be satisfied.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item_ → _Metadata of matched items_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

related_object.description: A reference to the object containing details of the related product. __Required__ when sending `source_id` in payload.

product.description: An object containing details of the related product. __Required__ when sending `source_id` in payload. These details will be used for qualification on top of details already stored in the system.

source_id.description: A unique product identifier from your inventory system.

name.description:
Product name.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item/None of the order items_ → _Select a product collection or create a new product collection based on name filters_.

price.description: Unit price of an item. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

metadata.description:
A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **product** metadata validation rules to be satisfied.

 The qualification runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Order structure_ → _Every order item/Any order item/None of the order items_ → _Select a product collection or create a new product collection based on metadata filters_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

CampaignBase.title: Campaign Base
CampaignBase.description: This is an object representing a campaign.

id.description: Unique campaign ID, assigned by Voucherify.

description.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the campaign such as a campaign description and details.

type.description:
Defines whether the campaign can be updated with new vouchers after campaign creation.    

- `AUTO_UPDATE`: the campaign is dynamic, i.e. vouchers will generate based on set criteria    
-  `STATIC`: vouchers need to be manually published

auto_join.description: Indicates whether customers will be able to auto-join a loyalty campaign if any earning rule is fulfilled.

join_once.description: If this value is set to `true`, customers will be able to join the campaign only once.

use_voucher_metadata_schema.description: Flag indicating whether the campaign is to use the voucher's metadata schema instead of the campaign metadata schema.

activity_duration_after_publishing.description: Defines the amount of time the vouchers will be active after publishing. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format. For example, a voucher with the value of P24D will be valid for a duration of 24 days.

vouchers_count.description: Total number of unique vouchers in campaign.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the campaign expires in ISO 8601 format.  Campaign is *inactive after* this date.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the campaign on or off. You can disable a campaign even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* campaign
- `false` indicates an *inactive* campaign

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the campaign. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a campaign object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the campaign in a structured format.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the campaign was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the campaign was last updated in ISO 8601 format.

category.description: Unique category name.

creation_status.description: Indicates the status of the campaign creation.

vouchers_generation_status.description: Indicates the status of the campaign's voucher generation.

readonly.description: Indicates whether the campaign can be only read by a restricted user in the Areas and Stores enterprise feature. It is returned only to restricted users; this field is not returned for users with other roles.

protected.description: Indicates whether the resource can be deleted.

category_id.description: Unique category ID that this campaign belongs to.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the campaign.

CodeConfigBase.title: Code Config Base
CodeConfigBase.description: Contains information about the config used for the voucher code. Defines the code's pattern (prefix, postfix, length, charset, etc).

length.description: Number of characters in a generated code (excluding prefix and postfix).

charset.description:
Characters that can appear in the code.  

Examples:

- Alphanumeric: `0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ` 
- Alphabetic: `abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ` 
- Alphabetic Lowercase: `abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz` 
- Alphabetic Uppercase: `ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ` 
- Numbers: `0123456789`  
- Custom: a custom character set

prefix.description: A text appended before the code.

postfix.description: A text appended after the code.

pattern.description: A pattern for codes where hashes (#) will be replaced with random characters. Overrides `length`.

CodeConfig.title: Code Config
CodeConfig.description: Contains information about the config used for the voucher code. Defines the code's pattern (prefix, postfix, length, charset, etc).

prefix.description: A text appended before the code.

postfix.description: A text appended after the code.

pattern.description: A pattern for codes where hashes (#) will be replaced with random characters. Overrides `length`.

initial_count.description: Internal value, does not change anything if provided.

2_loyalty_tiers_expiration_balance.title: Balance
2_loyalty_tiers_expiration_balance.description: Defines the Balance expiration mechanism for loyalty tiers.

qualification_type.description:
Tier qualification.   

`BALANCE`: Points balance is based on the customer's current points balance. Customers qualify for the tier if their points balance is in the points range of the tier.

start_date.description: Defines the conditions for the start date of the tier.

type.description:
What triggers the tier to be valid for a customer.    
`IMMEDIATE`: After reaching the minimum required points.

expiration_date.description: Defines the conditions for the expiration date of a tier.

2_loyalty_tiers_expiration_balance_expir.title: Balance Drop
2_loyalty_tiers_expiration_balance_expir.description: Defines the conditions for the expiration date of a tier based on a pure balance drop.

type.description:
What triggers the tier to expire for a customer.    
`BALANCE_DROP`: Tier expires when the points balance drops below the required range of the tier.

2_loyalty_tiers_expiration_balance_expir.title: Custom
2_loyalty_tiers_expiration_balance_expir.description: Defines the custom conditions for the expiration date of a tier.

type.description:
What triggers the tier to expire for a customer.    
`CUSTOM`: Tier expires after a certain time period passes following the instance the points balance drops below the required range of the tier.

extend.description: Defines the amount of time the tier will remain active in ISO 8601 format. The expiration date counter starts at the moment when the customer reaches the minimum required points that are required to be in the tier. For example, a tier with a duration of P3M will be valid for a duration of 3 months.

rounding.description: Defines the rounding mechanism for tier expiration.

2_loyalty_tiers_expiration_expiration_da.title: Calendar Periods
2_loyalty_tiers_expiration_expiration_da.description: Defines the rounding mechanism for tier expiration based on a list of available time periods.

type.description:
Period to which the expiration will be rounded to.    
- `MONTH`: The expiration date will be rounded to the end of the month. 
- `QUARTER`: The expiration date will be rounded to the end of the quarter. 
- `HALF_YEAR`: The expiration date will be rounded to the half year. 
- `YEAR`: The expiration date will be rounded to the end of the year.

strategy.description: Which portion of the given period should the rounding be applied to.

2_loyalty_tiers_expiration_expiration_da.title: Specific Month
2_loyalty_tiers_expiration_expiration_da.description: Defines the custom rounding mechanism for tier expiration.

type.description: This mechanism describes a custom rounding for the expiration date.

strategy.description: Which portion of the given period should the rounding be applied to.

unit.description: Defines the type of unit of time in which the rounding period is counted.

value.description:
Value for the unit of time that the rounding applies to. Units for this parameter are defined by the `rounding.unit` parameter.    
- `0`: January
- `1`: February
- `2`: March
- `3`: April
- `4`: May
- `5`: June
- `6`: July
- `7`: August
- `8`: September
- `9`: October
- `10`: November
- `11`: December

2_loyalty_tiers_expiration_points_in_per.title: Points in Period
2_loyalty_tiers_expiration_points_in_per.description: Defines the Points in Period expiration mechanism for loyalty tiers.

qualification_type.description:
Tier qualification.   

`POINTS_IN_PERIOD`: A customer qualifies for the tier only if the sum of the accumulated points in a **defined time interval** reaches the tier threshold.

qualification_period.description:
Customers can qualify for the tier if they collected enough points in a given time period. So, in addition to the customer having to reach a points range, they also need to have collected the points within a set time period. | **Period** | **Definition** | |:---|:---| | **Calendar Month** | Points collected in one calendar month
January, February, March, etc. | | **Calendar Quarter** | Points collected in the quarter
- January - March
- April - June
- July - September
- October - December | | **Calendar Half-year** | Points collected in the half-year
- January - June
- July - December | | **Calendar Year** | Points collected in one calendar year
January - December |

start_date.description: Defines the conditions for the start date of the tier.

type.description:
What triggers the tier to be valid for a customer.    
`IMMEDIATE`: After reaching the minimum required points.    
`NEXT_PERIOD`: When the next qualification period starts.

expiration_date.description: Defines the conditions for the expiration date of a tier.

type.description:
What triggers the tier to expire for a customer.    
`END_OF_PERIOD`: Expire tier at the end of the period.    
`END_OF_NEXT_PERIOD`:  Expire tier at the end of the next period.

extend.description: Extend the expiration by adding extra months or days in ISO 8601 format. The tier will remain active even though it reaches its expiration time period. For example, a tier with a duration of `P3M` will be valid for an additional duration of 3 months and a tier with a duration of `P1D` will be valid for an additional duration of 1 day.

CampaignsCreateBase.title: Campaign Create Schema Base
CampaignsCreateBase.description: Base body schema for creating a campaign using **POST** `v1/campaigns`.

description.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the campaign such as a campaign description and details.

type.description:
Defines whether the campaign can be updated with new vouchers after campaign creation.    

- `AUTO_UPDATE`: By choosing the auto update option you will create a campaign that can be enhanced by new vouchers after the time of creation (e.g. by publish vouchers method).    
-  `STATIC`: vouchers need to be manually published.

join_once.description: If this value is set to `true`, customers will be able to join the campaign only once.

auto_join.description: Indicates whether customers will be able to auto-join a loyalty campaign if any earning rule is fulfilled.

use_voucher_metadata_schema.description: Flag indicating whether the campaign is to use the voucher's metadata schema instead of the campaign metadata schema.

vouchers_count.description: Total number of unique vouchers in campaign (size of campaign).

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the campaign expires in ISO 8601 format.  Campaign is *inactive after* this date.

activity_duration_after_publishing.description: Defines the amount of time the vouchers will be active after publishing. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format. For example, a voucher with the value of P24D will be valid for a duration of 24 days.

validation_rules.description: Array containing the ID of the validation rule associated with the promotion tier.

category_id.description: Unique category ID that this campaign belongs to. Either pass this parameter OR the `category`.

category.description: The category assigned to the campaign. Either pass this parameter OR the `category_id`.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the campaign. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a campaign object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the campaign in a structured format.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the campaign expires in ISO 8601 format.  Campaign is *inactive after* this date.

category.description: The category assigned to the campaign. Either pass this parameter OR the `category_id`.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the campaign. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a campaign object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the campaign in a structured format.

2_req_add_vouchers_with_specific_code_to.title: Add Vouchers with Specific Code to Campaign Request Body

category_id.description: Unique category ID that you would like to assign to the voucher.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the voucher starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Voucher is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the voucher expires in ISO 8601 format.  Voucher is *inactive after* this date.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the voucher on or off. You can disable a voucher even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* voucher
- `false` indicates an *inactive* voucher

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the voucher. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

redemption.description: Stores the quantity of redemptions that can be applied to the voucher.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

additional_info.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the code such as a code description and details.

AccessSettingsCampaignAssignmentsList.title: Access Settings Campaign Assignments List
AccessSettingsCampaignAssignmentsList.description: Lists all assignments of the campaign to areas and stores if the Areas and Stores feature is enabled (Enterprise feature).

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. Default is `list`. This object stores information about campaign assignments to areas and stores

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of campaign assignments.

data.description: Contains an array of campaign assignments.

total.description: Total number of areas and stores to which the campaign is assigned.

AreaStoreCampaignAssignment.title: Areas and Stores Campain Assignment
AreaStoreCampaignAssignment.description: An object representing an assignment of a campaign to an area or store.

id.description: Unique identifier of the campaign assignment.

area_id.description: Unique identifier of the area to which the campaign is assigned.

area_store_id.description: Unique identifier of the store to which the campaign is assigned.

created_at.description: Date and time when the assignment was made. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the campaign assignment to areas or stores.

customer.description: Customer's information.

order.description: Order information. This object enables you to pass purchase transaction data. Read what properties you can use in the <!-- [Order object reference](OpenAPI.json/components/schemas/OrdersUpdateResponseBody) -->[Order object](ref:get-order).

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about campaigns in a dictionary.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of campaign objects.

data.description: Contains array of campaign objects.

total.description: Total valid and active campaigns matching the qualification criteria in given context.

id.description: Unique qualification ID.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the qualification was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

2_obj_campaign_object_campaigns_qualific.title: Campaign Object
2_obj_campaign_object_campaigns_qualific.description: This is an object representing a campaign.

id.description: Unique campaign ID, assigned by Voucherify.

description.description: An optional field to keep any extra textual information about the campaign such as a campaign description and details.

type.description:
Defines whether the campaign can be updated with new vouchers after campaign creation.    

- `AUTO_UPDATE`: the campaign is dynamic, i.e. vouchers will generate based on set criteria    
-  `STATIC`: vouchers need to be manually published

auto_join.description: Indicates whether customers will be able to auto-join a loyalty campaign if any earning rule is fulfilled.

join_once.description: If this value is set to `true`, customers will be able to join the campaign only once.

use_voucher_metadata_schema.description: Flag indicating whether the campaign is to use the voucher's metadata schema instead of the campaign metadata schema.

activity_duration_after_publishing.description: Defines the amount of time the vouchers will be active after publishing. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format. For example, a voucher with the value of P24D will be valid for a duration of 24 days.

vouchers_count.description: Total number of unique vouchers in campaign.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the campaign expires in ISO 8601 format.  Campaign is *inactive after* this date.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the campaign on or off. You can disable a campaign even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* campaign
- `false` indicates an *inactive* campaign

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the campaign. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a campaign object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the campaign in a structured format.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the campaign was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the voucher was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

category.description: Unique category name.

creation_status.description: Indicates the status of the campaign creation.

vouchers_generation_status.description: Indicates the status of the campaign's vouchers.

protected.description: Indicates whether the resource can be deleted.

validation_rules_assignments.description: Stores information about validation rules assigned to the campaign.

object.description: The type of the object represented is by default `list`.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of validation rule assignments.

data.description: Array of validation rule assignment objects. Each validation rule assignment object contains details about the rule.

id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the validation rule assignment.

rule_id.description: Assigned by the Voucherify API, identifies the validation rule.

related_object_id.description: ID of the object from which the rule originates.

related_object_type.description: Which object does the rule originate from: the  `voucher` itself or inherited from its parent `campaign`.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the validation rule was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

object.description: The type of resource represented by the object. Default is `validation_rules_assignment`.

rule.description: Describes the details of the rule.

total.description: Total number of validation rules assigned to the campaign.

category_id.description: Unique category ID that this campaign belongs to.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the campaign.

referral_program.description: Defines the referee reward and the way a referral is triggered. Context: `REFERRAL_PROGRAM`.

custom_event.description: Contains details about the custom event.

id.description: Unique custom event ID.

related_object_parent.description: Details of the resource from which the reward originates.

id.description: Unique ID of the reward source.

object.description: Type of resource represented by the source of the reward.

type.description: Type of reward.

amount.description: The number of `points` to add to a loyalty card or `credits` to the balance on a gift card. In case of the gift card, the value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about campaigns in a dictionary.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of campaign objects.

total.description: Total number of campaigns.

2_obj_campaign_object_voucher_object_DIS.description: Schema model for a discount voucher.
2_obj_campaign_object_voucher_object_DIS.title: Discount Voucher

type.description: Type of voucher.

discount.description: Defines the voucher discount type and details.

redemption.description: Defines the redemption limits on vouchers.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

code_config.description: Defines code's pattern (prefix, suffix, length, charset, etc).

length.description: Number of characters in a generated code (excluding prefix and postfix).

charset.description:
Characters that can appear in the code.  

Examples:

- Alphanumeric: `0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ` 
- Alphabetic: `abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ` 
- Alphabetic Lowercase: `abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz` 
- Alphabetic Uppercase: `ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ` 
- Numbers: `0123456789`  
- Custom: a custom character set

prefix.description: A text appended before the code.

postfix.description: A text appended after the code.

pattern.description: A pattern for codes where hashes (#) will be replaced with random characters. Overrides `length`.

is_referral_code.description: Flag indicating whether this voucher is a referral code; `true` for campaign type `REFERRAL_PROGRAM`.

effect.description: Defines how the credits are applied to the customer's order.

redemption.description: Defines the redemption limits on vouchers.

quantity.description: How many times a voucher can be redeemed. A `null` value means unlimited.

SimplePromotionTier.title: Simple Promotion Tier
SimplePromotionTier.description: This is an object representing a simple promotion tier. Promotion tiers are always assigned to a campaign and cannot be used standalone.

id.description: Unique promotion tier ID.

banner.description: Text to be displayed to your customers on your website.

campaign.description: Contains details about promotion tier's parent campaign.

id.description: Unique campaign ID.

metadata.description: A set of custom key/value pairs that you can attach to a promotion tier. The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the promotion tier.

PromotionTier.description: This is an object representing a promotion tier. Promotion tiers are always assigned to a campaign and cannot be used standalone.
PromotionTier.title: Promotion Tier

id.description: Unique promotion tier ID.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the promotion tier was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the promotion tier was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

banner.description: Text to be displayed to your customers on your website.

action.description: Contains details about the discount applied by the promotion tier.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the promotion tier. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a promotion tier object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the promotion tier in a structured format.

hierarchy.description: The promotions hierarchy defines the order in which the discounts from different tiers will be applied to a customer's order. If a customer qualifies for discounts from more than one tier, discounts will be applied in the order defined in the hierarchy.

campaign.description: Contains details about promotion tier's parent campaign.

id.description: Unique campaign ID.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Expiration timestamp defines when the campaign expires in ISO 8601 format.  Campaign is *inactive after* this date.

active.description:
A flag indicating whether the campaign is active or not active. A campaign can be disabled even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date` using the <!-- [Disable Campaign](OpenAPI.json/paths/~1campaigns~1{campaignId}~1disable) -->[Disable Campaign](ref:disable-campaign) endpoint.  

- `true` indicates an *active* campaign
- `false` indicates an *inactive* campaign

category_id.description: Unique category ID that this campaign belongs to.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the campaign object. This object stores information about the campaign.

campaign_id.description: Promotion tier's parent campaign's unique ID.

active.description:
A flag to toggle the promotion tier on or off. You can disable a promotion tier even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* promotion tier
- `false` indicates an *inactive* promotion tier

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive before* this date.

expiration_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier expires in ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive after* this date.

summary.description: Contains statistics about promotion tier redemptions and orders.

redemptions.description: Contains statistics about promotion tier redemptions.

total_redeemed.description: Number of times the promotion tier was redeemed.

orders.description: Contains statistics about orders related to the promotion tier.

total_discount_amount.description: Sum of total discount applied using the promotion tier.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the promotion tier.

category_id.description: Promotion tier category ID.

4_obj_reward_object.title: Reward Object
4_obj_reward_object.description: This is an object representing a reward.

id.description: Unique reward ID, assigned by Voucherify.

type.description: Reward type.

parameters.description: Defines how the reward is generated.

stock.description: Configurable for **material rewards**. The number of units of the product that you want to share as reward.

redeemed.description: Defines the number of already invoked (successful) reward redemptions.

attributes.description: These properties are configurable for **material rewards**.

image_url.description: The HTTPS URL pointing to the .png or .jpg file.

description.description: An arbitrary string that you can attach to a material reward.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the reward was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the reward was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the reward. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a reward object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the reward in a structured format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the reward.

4_obj_reward_object_parameters_CAMPAIGN.title: Digital
4_obj_reward_object_parameters_CAMPAIGN.description: These are parameters representing a digital (CAMPAIGN) reward. These can be in the form of discount coupons, gift card credits, or loyalty point credits.

campaign.description: Objects stores information about the campaign related to the reward.

4_obj_reward_object_parameters_CAMPAIGN_.title: Discount Coupons
4_obj_reward_object_parameters_CAMPAIGN_.description: These are parameters representing a discount coupon, which is a subset of a Digital (CAMPAIGN) reward.

id.description: Unique campaign ID, assigned by Voucherify.

type.description: Campaign type.

4_obj_reward_object_parameters_CAMPAIGN_.title: Gift Vouchers
4_obj_reward_object_parameters_CAMPAIGN_.description: These are parameters representing a gift voucher, which is a subset of a Digital (CAMPAIGN) reward.

id.description: Unique campaign ID, assigned by Voucherify.

balance.description: The incremental amount to be added to the current balance on the gift card. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, $100 amount is written as 10000.

type.description: Campaign type.

4_obj_reward_object_parameters_CAMPAIGN_.title: Points on loyalty card
4_obj_reward_object_parameters_CAMPAIGN_.description: These are parameters representing points on a loyalty card, which is a subset of a Digital (CAMPAIGN) reward.

id.description: Unique campaign ID, assigned by Voucherify.

balance.description: The incremental points to be added to the current balance on the loyalty card.

type.description: Campaign type.

4_obj_reward_object_parameters_COIN.title: Pay with Points
4_obj_reward_object_parameters_COIN.description: These are parameters representing a Pay with Points (COIN) reward.

coin.description: Defines the ratio by mapping the number of loyalty points in `points_ratio` to a predefined cash amount in `exchange_ratio`.

exchange_ratio.description: The cash equivalent of the points defined in the `points_ratio` property.

points_ratio.description: The number of loyalty points that will map to the predefined cash amount defined by the `exchange_ratio` property.

4_obj_reward_object_parameters_MATERIAL.title: Material
4_obj_reward_object_parameters_MATERIAL.description: These are parameters representing products as a (MATERIAL) reward.

product.description: Contains information about the product given as a reward.

id.description: Unique product ID, assigned by Voucherify.

sku_id.description: Unique SKU ID, assigned by Voucherify, of the SKU given as a reward.

6_req_session_lock_discount_code.title: Discount Code Session Lock
6_req_session_lock_discount_code.description: Schema model for `session` lock object. The session object is **required** to establish a session between multiple parallel validation and redemption requests. If you only send the `type` parameter in the request, then by default the session lock will be established for 7 days. Read more on establishing a <!-- [validation session](..docs/guides/campaign_recipes/Locking-Validation-Session.md) -->[validation session](doc:locking-validation-session).

type.description: This parameter is **required** to establish a new session. The session locks the redemption **quantity** by 1.

key.description: The session unique ID assigned by Voucherify or your own unique session ID. Sending an existing ID will result in overwriting an existing session. If no session key is provided, then a new ID will be generated.

ttl_unit.description: Defines the type of unit in which the session time is counted.

ttl.description: Value for the period of time that the session is active. Units for this parameter are defined by the `session.ttl_unit` parameter.

6_req_session_lock_gift_card.title: Gift Card Session Lock
6_req_session_lock_gift_card.description: Schema model for `session` lock object. Read more on establishing a <!-- [validation session](..docs/guides/campaign_recipes/Locking-Validation-Session.md) -->[validation session](doc:locking-validation-session).

type.description: This parameter is **required** to establish a new session. The session locks the redemption **quantity** by 1 and the redemption **gift credits** specified within the request.

key.description: The session unique ID assigned by Voucherify or your own unique session ID. Sending an existing ID will result in overwriting an existing session. If no session key is provided, then a new ID will be generated.

ttl.description: Value for the period of time that the session is active. Units for this parameter are defined by the `session.ttl_unit` parameter.

6_res_validate_voucher_false.title: Not Valid
6_res_validate_voucher_false.description: Response schema for a voucher that is not valid.

valid.description: Indicates whether the voucher is valid within the context of the parameters provided in the request body.

reason.description: System generated cause for the voucher being invalid in the context of the provided parameters.

error.description: Detailed failure cause for the invalid voucher if the reason has a translation defined in the Dashboard → Project Settings → Error Messages.

message.description: Customized error message.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the code. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a voucher object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the voucher in a structured format.

6_res_validate_voucher_discount_amount.title: Amount Discount
6_res_validate_voucher_discount_amount.description: This is an object representing the discount that the customer would receive in the context of the provided request body parameters. If the discount is calculated based on a formula, this object will return either the discount calculated based on the formula or the fallback value.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

amount_off.description: Amount taken off the subtotal of a price. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000.

6_res_validate_voucher_discount_percent.title: Percent Discount
6_res_validate_voucher_discount_percent.description: This is an object representing the discount that the customer would receive in the context of the provided request body parameters. If the discount is calculated based on a formula, this object will return either the discount calculated based on the formula or the fallback value.

type.description: Defines the type of the voucher.

effect.description: Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.

percent_off.description: The percent discount that the customer will receive.

amount_limit.description: Upper limit allowed to be applied as a discount. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $6 maximum discount is written as 600.

is_dynamic.description: Flag indicating whether the discount was calculated using a formula.

6_res_validate_voucher_discount_fixed.title: Fixed Discount
6_res_validate_voucher_discount_fixed.description: This is an object representing the discount that the customer would receive in the context of the provided request body parameters. If the discount is calculated based on a formula, this object will return either the discount calculated based on the formula or the fallback value. A fixed discounts sets a fixed total on cart or item(s) and then calculates the discount to apply.

type.description: Type of discount.

effect.description:
Defines how the discount is applied to the customer's order.    
    
| **Effect** | **Definition** |
|---|---|
| **APPLY_TO_ORDER** | Sets the order total amount to the value of the fixed amount. The discount value is calculated during the redemption as it's a difference between the total amount of the customer's order and the fixed amount. |
| **APPLY_TO_ITEMS** | Sets a new price on items. The total discount amount is calculated during the redemption and it's a difference between the initial item price and the fixed amount. |

fixed_amount.description: Sets a fixed value for an order total or the item price. The value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example, a $10 discount is written as 1000. If the fixed amount is calculated by the formula, i.e. the `fixed_amount_formula` parameter is present in the fixed amount definition, this value becomes the **fallback value**. As a result, if the formula cannot be calculated due to missing metadata, for example, this value will be used as the fixed value.

6_res_validate_voucher_discount_unit.title: Unit Discount, single item
6_res_validate_voucher_discount_unit.description: This is an object representing the discount that the customer would receive in the context of the provided request body parameters. If the discount is calculated based on a formula, this object will return either the discount calculated based on the formula or the fallback value.

product.description: Contains information about the product.

id.description: Unique product ID, assigned by Voucherify.

6_res_applicable_to_object.title: Included  Items
6_res_applicable_to_object.description: Contains list of items that qualify in the scope of the discount. These are definitions of included products, SKUs, and product collections. These can be discounted.

data.description: Contains array of items to which the discount can apply.

total.description: Total number of objects defining included products, SKUs, or product collections.

data_ref.description: Identifies the name of the attribute that contains the array of included objects.

6_res_inapplicable_to_object.title: Excluded Items
6_res_inapplicable_to_object.description: Contains list of items that **do not** qualify in the scope of the discount. These are definitions of excluded products, SKUs, and product collections. These **CANNOT** be discounted.

total.description: Total number of objects defining excluded products, SKUs, or product collections.

6_obj_order_object.title: Order object
6_obj_order_object.description: This is an object representing an order with calculated discounts applied using the voucher code.

6_obj_order_object_apply_to_order.title: Order object - Effect: Apply to order
6_obj_order_object_apply_to_order.description: This is an object representing an order with calculated discounts applied using the voucher code.

id.description: Unique order ID, assigned by Voucherify. This parameter is returned only if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body.

source_id.description: The merchant's order ID if it is different from the Voucherify order ID. It is really useful in case of integration between multiple systems. It can be an order ID from CRM, database or 3rd party service. This parameter is returned only if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format. This parameter is returned only if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format. This parameter is returned only if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body.

status.description: Order status. This parameter is returned if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body or if you send the request body parameter when defining an order in the request body. This parameter can be passed but it's not required for validation at all. It's used in the redemption process. Normally after the redemption is done, the order is automatically to a `PAID` status. To avoid such default behaviour, the user can pass any of the other status options and it will be set the order status after the redemption instead of the default `PAID`.

amount.description: Order amount before applying any discount.

discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-level discounts applied to the order.

total_amount.description:
Order amount after applying all the discounts.  
`total_amount` = `amount` - `total_discount_amount`

applied_discount_amount.description: This field shows the order-level discount applied.

total_applied_discount_amount.description: This field sums up all order-level discounts applied to the order.

items.description: Array of order items that have been applied to the order. Each order item can show the effects of particular discounts on the item-level.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the `order_item`.

product_id.description: A unique identifier that represents the product and is assigned by Voucherify.

sku_id.description: A unique identifier that represents the SKU and is assigned by Voucherify.

quantity.description: Quantity of the item in the cart.

amount.description: Represents a total pre-discount amount of order item (`price` * `quantity`).

price.description: Unit price of an item. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

subtotal_amount.description:
Final order item amount after the applied item-level discount.  If there are no item-level discounts applied, this item is equal to the `amount`.   
`subtotal_amount`=`amount`-`discount_amount`

product.description: This object stores more information about the related product.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the product and is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: A unique product identifier from your inventory system.

price.description: Unit price of a product. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

sku.description: This object stores more information about the related SKU.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the SKU and is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: A unique SKU identifier from your inventory system.

price.description: Unit price of a SKU. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the order. A set of key/value pairs that are att to an order object. Stores additional information about the order in a structured format.

customer.description: Object containing information about the customer that is making the purchase.

id.description: Unique customer ID of the customer making the purchase.

object.description: Type of object represented by the `customer` object.

referrer.description: Object containing information about the referrer.

id.description: Unique referrer ID, who referred the customer making the purchase.

object.description: Type of object represented by the `referrer` object.

customer_id.description: Unique customer ID of the customer making the purchase.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the `order`.

6_obj_order_object_apply_to_items.description: This is an object representing an order with calculated discounts applied using the voucher code.

id.description: Unique order ID, assigned by Voucherify. This parameter is returned only if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body.

source_id.description: The merchant's order ID if it is different from the Voucherify order ID. It is really useful in case of integration between multiple systems. It can be an order ID from CRM, database or 3rd party service. This parameter is returned only if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format. This parameter is returned only if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format. This parameter is returned only if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body.

status.description: Order status. This parameter is returned if you use the order ID parameter of an already created and synced order in the Voucherify application, i.e by sending the `order.id` parameter in the request body or if you send the request body parameter when defining an order in the request body. This parameter can be passed but it's not required for validation at all. It's used in the redemption process. Normally after the redemption is done, the order is automatically to a `PAID` status. To avoid such default behaviour, the user can pass any of the other status options and it will be set the order status after the redemption instead of the default `PAID`.

amount.description: Order amount before applying any discount.

items_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all product-specific discounts applied.  
`sum(items, i => i.discount_amount)`

total_discount_amount.description: Sum of all product-specific discounts applied.

total_amount.description:
Order amount after applying all the discounts.  
`total_amount` = `amount` - `total_discount_amount`

items_applied_discount_amount.description: Product-specifc discounts applied to all the items.

total_applied_discount_amount.description: Product-specific discounts applied in the order.

items.description: Array of order items that have been applied to the order. Each order item can show the effects of particular discounts on the item-level.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the `order_item`.

sku_id.description: A unique identifier that represents the SKU and is assigned by Voucherify.

price.description: Unit price of an item. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

subtotal_amount.description:
Final order item amount after the applied item-level discount.  If there are no item-level discounts applied, this item is equal to the `amount`.   
`subtotal_amount`=`amount`-`discount_amount`

items.title: Order Item
items.description: This object represents an order line item.

source_id.description: The merchant's product/SKU ID (if it is different from the Voucherify product/SKU ID). It is useful in the integration between multiple systems. It can be an ID from an eCommerce site, a database, or a third-party service.

related_object.description: Used along with the `source_id` property, can be set to either `sku` or `product`.

product_id.description: Unique identifier of the product. It is assigned by Voucherify.

sku_id.description: Unique identifier of the SKU. It is assigned by Voucherify.

quantity.description: The quantity of the particular item in the cart.

price.description: The unit price of the item.

amount.description: The total amount of the order item (`price` * `quantity`).

6_req_validate_promotion.title: Validate Promotion Request Body
6_req_validate_promotion.description: Request schema model for validating a promotion using **POST** `v1/promotions/validation`.

customer.description: Customer's information.

order.description: Order information.

metadata.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can send in the request body to check against vouchers requiring **redemption** metadata validation rules to be satisfied. The validation runs against rules that are defined through the <!-- [Create Validation Rules](https://docs.voucherify.io/reference/create-validation-rules) -->[Create Validation Rules](ref:create-validation-rules) endpoint or via the Dashboard; in the _Advanced Rule Builder_ → _Advanced_ → _Redemption metadata satisfy_ or _Basic Builder_ → _Attributes match_ → _REDEMPTION METADATA_. [Read more](https://support.voucherify.io/article/148-how-to-build-a-rule).

options.description: Configure parameters returned in the response.

expand.description: The expand array lets you configure the parameters included in the response. Depending on the strings included in the array, the response will contain different details. Add `category` as a string in the array to include a `categories` object in the response.

6_res_validate_promotion.title: Validate Promotion Response Body
6_res_validate_promotion.description: Response schema model for validating a promotion using **POST** `v1/promotions/validation`.

valid.description: Indicates whether the promotion is valid within the context of the parameters provided in the request body and filters in the query parameters.

promotions.description: Contains an array of promotion tier objects.

valid.description: Indicates whether the promotion is valid within the context of the parameters provided in the request body and filters in the query parameters.

id.description: Unique promotion tier ID.

banner.description: Text to be displayed to your customers on your website.

discount.description: Contains information about the discount to be applied to the order.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive* before this date.

expiration_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the promotion tier expires in ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive* after this date.

id.description: Unique promotion tier ID.

start_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign starts to be active in ISO 8601 format. Campaign is *inactive* before this date.

expiration_date.description: Activation timestamp defines when the campaign expires in ISO 8601 format. Promotion tier is *inactive* after this date.

active.description:
A flag indicating whether the campaign is active or not active. A campaign can be disabled even though it's within the active period defined by the `start_date` and `expiration_date`.  

- `true` indicates an *active* campaign
- `false` indicates an *inactive* campaign

object.description: The type of the object represented by the campaign object. This object stores information about the campaign.

hierarchy.description: The promotions hierarchy defines the order in which the discounts from different tiers will be applied to a customer's order. If a customer qualifies for discounts from more than one tier, discounts will be applied in the order defined in the hierarchy.

discount_amount.description: The calculated discount amount based on the discount type and effect.

applied_discount_amount.description: The effective discount amount that would be applied to the order.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the promotion tier. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a promotion tier object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the promotion tier in a structured format.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the promotion tier.

category_id.description: Promotion tier category ID.

categories.description: Details about the category assigned to the promotion tier.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the promotion tier.

message.description: Customized error message.

id.description: Unique order ID, assigned by Voucherify.

RedeemGiftCard.title: Gift Card Redeemable
RedeemGiftCard.description: Validate or redeem a gift card

gift.description: Contains information on the number of gift card credits that the customer wants to apply to the order.

credits.description: The number of credits that the user wants to use from the gift card to fulfill the order. The value of credits cannot be higher than the current balance on the gift card. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

RedeemLoyaltyCard.title: Loyalty Card Redeemable
RedeemLoyaltyCard.description: Validate or redeem a loyalty card

reward.description: Contains information about the reward that the customer wants to redeem and the number of points the customer is choosing to use for the reward.

id.description: Unique reward ID assigned by Voucherify. The reward must be assigned to the campaign in order for the user to be able to use the reward.

points.description: The number of loyalty points that the user wants to spend in order to fulfill the order using a **pay with points** reward. The number of points cannot be higher than the current balance on the loyalty card.

RedeemVoucher.title: Voucher Redeemable
RedeemVoucher.description: Validate or redeem a discount code.

object.description: Redeemable object type.

id.description: Redeemable code.

redeemables.description: An array of redeemables. You can combine `voucher`(s) and `promotion_tier`(s). Alternatively, send one unique`promotion_stack` in the array.

items.title: Stackable Validate Redeem Base Redeemables Item

order.description: Order information.

customer.description: Customer's information.

session.description: Schema model for session lock object. The session object is required to establish a session between multiple parallel validation and redemption requests. If you only send the type parameter in the request, then by default the session lock will be established for 7 days. Read more on establishing a validation session.

metadata.description: A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a redemption object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the redemption in a structured format.

options.description: Configure parameters returned in the response.

expand.description:
The expand array lets you configure the parameters included in the response. Depending on the strings included in the array, the response will contain different details. | **Expand Option** | **Response Body** | |:---|:---| | ["order"] | - Same response as fallback response (without an options object).
- Order data with calculated discounts are listed in each child redeemable object.
- Metadata not included for each discount type. | | ["redeemable"] | Expands redeemable objects by including `metadata` for each discount type. | | ["order", "redeemable"] | - Order data with calculated discounts are listed in each child redeemable object.
- Includes `metadata` for each discount type. | | ["category"] | - Returns an expanded `categories` object, showing details about the category. |

options.description: Configure parameters returned in the response.

expand.description:
Expand array lets you configure params included in the response. Depending on the strings included in the array, the response will contain different details. | **Expand Option** | **Response Body** | |:---|:---| | ["order"] | - Same response as fallback response (without an options object).
- Order data with calculated discounts are listed in each child redeemable object.
- Metadata not included for each discount type. | | ["redeemable"] | Expands redeemable objects by including `metadata` for each discount type. | | ["order", "redeemable"] | - Order data with calculated discounts are listed in each child redeemable object.
- Includes `metadata` for each discount type. | | ["redeemable", "redemption", "category"] | - Returns each discount type's `metadata` in each child redemption object.
- Returns redemption object `metadata`.
- Returns an expanded `categories` object, showing details about the category. |

valid.description: The result of the validation. It takes all of the redeemables into account and returns a `false` if at least one redeemable is inapplicable. Returns `true` if all redeemables are applicable.

redeemables.description: Lists validation results of each redeemable. If redeemables_application_mode="PARTIAL" all redeemables here will be "APPLICABLE"

7_obj_order_object_apply_to_order.title: Order object - Effect: Apply to order
7_obj_order_object_apply_to_order.description: This is an object representing an order with calculated discounts applied using the voucher code.

id.description: Unique order ID, assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The merchant's order ID if it is different from the Voucherify order ID. It is really useful in case of integration between multiple systems. It can be an order ID from CRM, database or 3rd party service.

created_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

updated_at.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the order was updated. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

amount.description: Order amount before applying any discount.

discount_amount.description: Sum of all order-level discounts applied to the order.

total_discount_amount.description:
Sum of all order-level AND all product-specific discounts applied to the order.  
`total_discount_amount` = `discount_amount` + `items_discount_amount`

total_amount.description:
Order amount after applying all the discounts.  
`total_amount` = `amount` - `total_discount_amount`

applied_discount_amount.description: This field shows the order-level discount applied.

total_applied_discount_amount.description: This field sums up all order-level and all product-specific discounts applied in a particular request.

items.description: Array of order items that have been applied to the order. Each order item can show the effects of particular discounts on the item-level.

object.description: The type of the object represented by JSON. This object stores information about the `order_item`.

product_id.description: A unique identifier that represents the product and is assigned by Voucherify.

sku_id.description: A unique identifier that represents the SKU and is assigned by Voucherify.

quantity.description: Quantity of the item in the cart.

amount.description: Represents a total pre-discount amount of order item (`price` * `quantity`).

price.description: Unit price of an item. Value is multiplied by 100 to precisely represent 2 decimal places. For example `10000 cents` for `$100.00`.

subtotal_amount.description:
Final order item amount after the applied item-level discount.  If there are no item-level discounts applied, this item is equal to the `amount`.

7_obj_redemption_object_voucher_extended.title: Redemption Object

7_obj_redemption_object_discount_voucher.title: Discount Voucher
7_obj_redemption_object_discount_voucher.description:
This is an object representing a redemption.  

Redemption is the key operation in the voucher and promotion tier lifecycle. A customer can redeem a voucher or promotion tier once or multiple times depending on selected limit (`quantity`). Each redemption is recorded in voucher/promotion's history (`redemption_entries`). There is also an option to cancel a redemption. We call such operation a <!-- [redemption rollback](OpenAPI.json/paths/~1redemptions~1{redemptionId}~1rollback/post) -->[redemption rollback](rollback-redemption).

id.description: Unique redemption ID.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the `redemption`.

date.description: Timestamp in ISO 8601 format indicating when the redemption occured.

customer_id.description: Unique customer ID of the redeeming customer.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes in the form of key/value pairs assigned to the redemption.

order.description: Defines the details of the order that is related to the redemption.

channel.description: Defines the details of the channel through which the redemption was issued.

channel_id.description: Unique channel ID of the user performing the redemption. This is either a user ID from a user using the Voucherify Dashboard or an X-APP-Id of a user using the API.

channel_type.description: The source of the channel for the redemption. A `USER` corresponds to the Voucherify Dashboard and an `API` corresponds to the API.

customer.description: Defines the customer that is related to the redemption.

id.description: The unique ID of a customer that is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The merchant's customer ID if it is different from the Voucherify customer ID. It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be a customer ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the customer. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a customer object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format.

object.description: Type of object represented is `customer`.

related_object_type.description:
Defines the related object.

| **Related Object** | **Definition** |
| :--- | :--- |
| voucher | Either a discount voucher, gift card, or loyalty card. |

related_object_id.description: Unique related object ID assigned by Voucherify, i.e. v_lfZi4rcEGe0sN9gmnj40bzwK2FH6QUno for a voucher.

voucher.description: Defines the details of the voucher being redeemed.

RedemptionRollback.title: Redemption Rollback
RedemptionRollback.description: This is an object representing a redemption rollback.

id.description: Unique identifier of the redemption rollback.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the JSON

date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the object was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

customer_id.description: Unique customer ID of the redeeming customer.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the redemption.

amount.description:
For gift cards, this represents the number of the credits restored to the card in the rolledback redemption. The number is a negative integer in the smallest currency unit, e.g. -100 cents for $1.00 added back to the card.
For loyalty cards, this represents the number of loyalty points restored to the card in the rolledback redemption. The number is a negative integer.

redemption.description: Unique redemption ID of the parent redemption.

reason.description: System generated cause for the redemption being invalid in the context of the provided parameters.

items.title: Redemption Rollback Related Redemptions Rollbacks Item

id.description: Unique identifier of the redemption rollback.

date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the object was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

items.title: Redemption Rollback Related Redemptions Item

id.description: Unique redemption ID.

date.description: Timestamp representing the date and time when the object was created. The value is shown in the ISO 8601 format.

failure_code.description: If the result is `FAILURE`, this parameter will provide a generic reason as to why the redemption failed.

failure_message.description: If the result is `FAILURE`, this parameter will provide a more expanded reason as to why the redemption failed.

channel.description: Defines the details of the channel through which the redemption was issued.

channel_id.description: Unique identifier of the channel which was used by the user performing the redemption rollback. This is either a user ID from the user using the Voucherify Dashboard or an X-APP-Id of a user using the API.

channel_type.description: The source of the channel for the redemption. A `USER` corresponds to the Voucherify Dashboard and an `API` corresponds to the API.

related_object_id.description: Unique identifier of the related object. It is assigned by Voucherify, i.e. `v_lfZi4rcEGe0sN9gmnj40bzwK2FH6QUno` for a voucher.

voucher.description: Defines the details of the voucher being originally redeemed.

promotion_tier.description: Contains details of the promotion tier and the parent campaign.

gift.description: Contains the amount returned to the gift card in the redemption rollback. It is expressed as a negative integer.

amount.description: Amount returned to the gift card as a result of the redemption rollback and expressed as a negative integer. The amount is expressed as the smallest currency unit (e.g. -100 cents for $1.00 returned).

loyalty_card.description: Contains the number of points returned to the loyalty card in the reward redemption rollback. It is expressed as a negative integer.

points.description: Number of points being returned to the loyalty card for the reward redemption rollback. It is expressed as a negative integer.

7_obj_redemption_object_loyalty_card.title: Loyalty Card Voucher
7_obj_redemption_object_loyalty_card.description:
This is an object representing a redemption.  

Redemption is the key operation in the voucher and promotion tier lifecycle. A customer can redeem a voucher or promotion tier once or multiple times depending on selected limit (`quantity`). Each redemption is recorded in voucher/promotion's history (`redemption_entries`). There is also an option to cancel a redemption. We call such operation a <!-- [redemption rollback](OpenAPI.json/paths/~1redemptions~1{redemptionId}~1rollback/post) -->[redemption rollback](rollback-redemption).

id.description: Unique redemption ID.

object.description: The type of the object represented by the JSON. This object stores information about the redemption.

date.description: Timestamp in ISO 8601 format indicating when the redemption occured.

customer_id.description: Unique customer ID of the redeeming customer.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes in the form of key/value pairs assigned to the redemption.

amount.description: Number of points being redeemed for a reward.

redemption.description: Unique redemption ID of the parent redemption if this particular redemption was issued through a stacked redemption.

order.description: Defines the details of the order that is related to the redemption.

channel.description: Defines the details of the channel through which the redemption was issued.

channel_id.description: Unique channel ID of the user performing the redemption. This is either a user ID from a user using the Voucherify Dashboard or an X-APP-Id of a user using the API.

channel_type.description: The source of the channel for the redemption. A `USER` corresponds to the Voucherify Dashboard and an `API` corresponds to the API.

customer.description: Defines the customer redeeming the reward.

id.description: The unique ID of a customer that is assigned by Voucherify.

source_id.description: The merchant's customer ID if it is different from the Voucherify customer ID. It is really useful in case of an integration between multiple systems. It can be a customer ID from a CRM system, database or 3rd-party service.

metadata.description: The metadata object stores all custom attributes assigned to the customer. A set of key/value pairs that you can attach to a customer object. It can be useful for storing additional information about the customer in a structured format.

object.description: Type of object represented is `customer`.

related_object_id.description: Unique related object ID assigned by Voucherify, i.e. `v_lfZi4rcEGe0sN9gmnj40bzwK2FH6QUno` for a voucher.

voucher.description: Defines the details of the voucher being redeemed.

id.description: Unique voucher ID assigned by Voucherify.

campaign_id.description: Unique campaign ID assigned by Voucherify.

loyalty_card.description: Stores the number of points being subtracted from the loyalty card for the reward redemption.

points.description: Number of points being subtracted from the loyalty card for the reward redemption.

7_obj_redemption_rollback_object_promoti.description: This is an object representing a promotion tier redemption rollback

id.description: Unique redemption rollback ID.

redemption.description: Unique redemption ID of initial redemption.
